question: Good morning, UPS! He tosses the box behind his back like a basketball, then acknowledges another passerby. UPS, good to see you! He takes a couple of steps, then flings the package incredibly high into the air, spins completely around and expertly drops to one knee and catches the box. A Hispanic man passes. Buenos dias. Uo Pay eSsay.
answer: Shut the hell up, you stupid mutt! An angry, burly man pokes his nose hairs out the chained door. What do you want?

question: UPS, sir. And how are you this afternoon? Alrighty then! The man grumpily unchains the door. He's a big guy - 6'5", 250, and 50 of that is chest hair. A small Shiatsu stands beside him. I have a package for you. The UPS guy thrusts the package toward the man. We can clearly hear broken glass inside. The man takes the package.
answer: It sounds broken.

question: Most likely sir! I bet it was something nice though! Now... I haver an insurance form. If you'll just sign here, here, and here, and initial here, and print your name here, we'll get the rest of the forms out to you as soon as we can. The man begrudgingly begins to fill out the form. The dog wags his tail and whines. We can see that he likes the UPS guy. That's a lovely dog you have. Do you mind if I pet him, sir?
answer: I don't give a rat's ass. The UPS Man bends down and talks to the dog in a really sucky pet talk.

question: Oo ja boo ba da boo boo do booo!
answer: Brother. Before the Gruff Man can finish, the UPS Man stands back up and takes the form again.

question: That's fine sir. I can fill out the rest. You just have yourself a good day. Take care, now! 'Bye 'bye, then! UPS, S'cuse me. UPS, comin' through.
answer: Hey, stupid! Get away from the door! The dog doesn't budge and this really pisses him off. He gets up and heads for the dog. What's the matter with you, I said GIT!!! He roughly picks the dog up by the scruff of the neck, but as he turns it around we see that it is a stuffed dog. Around it's neck is a business card that reads, "You have been had by Ace Ventura - Pet Detective." He breathes fire. Son of a bitch! He smashes the dog to the ground.

question: That was a close one, ladies and gentlemen. Unfortunately, in every contest, there must be... A LOOSER! He jumps into an old beat-up Chevy Bel Air, and lets the dog out onto the passenger seat. LOOOHOOOSERRRHERRR! He then pulls open the car's ashtray, and to the dog's delight, it's filled with puppy chow. He tries to start the engine but it won't turn over. The dog shoots him a look. No problem, it gets flooded. We'll just wait a few seconds. Ace sits back. SMASH!!! From Ace's POV we see a Baseball bat shatter the front windshield. Or, we could try it now. Ace frantically tries to start the car. His new friend continues around the car beating the living shit out of it. Oooh, boy. Warning! Assholes are closer than they appear! The dog is barking insanely. You think you can do better?! The baseball bat is now pummeling the trunk. Wanna give me a push while you're back there? BOOM! The back window shatters. Then the car's engine roars to life. Ace rejoices. FARFEGNUGENNNNN!!! Ace leaves the bad guy in a cloud of dust and gravel, screaming bloody murder. Well, the reward would be good, and there was some damage to my  She cuts Ace off with a devastating kiss. Ummmm Sure. She pulls him toward the bedroom. How did he find out? Does he have you followed.
answer: Here you go, honey. Now remember this kind of fish doesn't like it in the freezer. Don't worry, I'll make sure she gets a proper burial. Jennifer exits. Adelle calls to her cat, and tosses it the goldfish. The cat catches it in mid-air. Rest in peace. Ace enters the pet shop. It looks like he slept in his clothes. Well here comes another dead fish.

question: Hi, beautiful. What time do you get off?
answer: Uh oh.

question: I've heard some pretty great things about your kibble.
answer: Well, I hope I'm not getting a reputation.

question: Just get me the food! She chuckles at Ace as she loads a couple of bags with different kinds of pet food.
answer: So ahh, when can I expect you to pay your tab?

question: I'm a little bit Sli Pickins, right now, I'm a little Tight Squeeze Louise, a little Welfare Wolly, Potless Pissing Pete, I'm ah
answer: If you were a horse I'd shoot ya'. Just take it.

question: Gravy! I'm good for it, Adelle. I'm on a very big case right now. Ace reaches into his coat pocket and pulls out a flyer with a picture of a white pigeon. See this pigeon? It's a true albino. Some rich guy lost it. He's offering a ten thousand dollar reward.
answer: Wow, albino pigeons are very rare. How are you going to find him?

question: Just keep my eyes open, and hope to god it doesn't snow. Ace grabs his bags and heads for the door.
answer: You're a good boy, Ace. A good boy. He holds the door open for an elderly gentleman who is entering at the same time. The gentleman is walking a toy poodle on a leash. The poodle is dragging its butt along the entire length of the floor. Ace and Adelle just stare.

question: Venturaaaaa? Ace straightens up, but doesn't turn around.
answer: Yes, Satan? Now Ace turns around in mock surprise. Oh, I'm sorry, sir. You sounded like someone else.

question: Never mind the wise cracks Venturaaa. You owe me rent!
answer: Mr. Shickadance I told you, you're my first priority! As soon as I find the white pigeon, you're paid!!

question: I heard animals in there Ventura! I heard 'em again this morning, scratchin' around.
answer: I never bring my work home with me, sir. The landlord notices the bags of kibble.

question: Oh, yeah? What's all this pet food for?
answer: Fiber. The landlord isn't buying it. You wanna take a look for yourself? Go head. Ace rattles his keys in the door. Then he swings it open and turns on the light. The house is clear. Ace walks in as the landlord stands there snooping and sniffing the air. Well are you satisfied?

question: Yeah, but don't ever let me catch you with an animal in there, that's all!
answer: Okay then. Take care now. 'Bye 'bye. The landlord walks away as Ace closes the door. Ooshhooboobooboodoodoo!

question: Why did it have to happen now? I got three stinking years left till retirement.
answer: I've got forty.

question: I'll tell you who did it. It was those goddamn animal rights nuts! Always out there with their goddamn signs, ANIMALS WERE BORN FREE, STOP TORTURING SNOWFLAKE! That goddamn fish lives better than they do! They stop outside Melissa's office by her secretary's desk.
answer: The police are checking into the animal rights people. Martha, have the police called back about the dolphin yet?

question: A what?
answer: Thanks Martha, but we'd better leave this to professionals.

question: Thanks Martha, but we'd better leave this to professionals.
answer: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!!! The bird makes a clean getaway. Unable to stop his momentum, Ace flies past the edge of the building and slides down the side of the roof. Ace Ventura. Pet detective. The guard stares at Ace, accusingly.

question: Okay, send him in. Martha exits, Ace enters. Hi, I'm Melissa Robinson. Did you have any trouble getting in?
answer: No, the guy with the rubber glove was surprisingly gentle.

question: Super Bowl week. Security's tight. Mr. Ventura, I'll get right to the point She slips a tape in the VCR and gestures for Ace to sit. Our mascot was stolen from his tank last night. Are you familiar with Snowflake? The tape shows Snowflake doing a trick. The trainer, dressed like a quarterback, shouts out signals. We got Snowflake from the Miami Seaquarium. He's a rare Bottle Nose Dolphin. That's the new trick he was going to do during the half-time show. While Ace studies the tape, he chews sunflower seeds in a bird-like fashion, placing the shells in a neat little pile on her desk. Would you like an ashtray?
answer: No, I don't smoke. He adds more shells to the pile. Melissa is already wondering if she has made a mistake.

question: To be honest, Mr. Ventura. I'm pretty skeptical. Before today, I didn't even know there was such a thing as a pet detective.
answer: Well, now that you do, you'll know who to call if your Schnauser ever runs away.

question: How did you know I have a Schnauser? Ace pulls a, invisible-to-the-naked-eye dog hair off here blouse and presents it to her.
answer: He's young, about five pounds, black coat, white speckles likes to chase cars.

question: Very impressive.
answer: You should see what I can do with a good stool sample.

question: I can hardly wait. Look, we've got a problem. Can you help me or not?
answer: Well, sea faring creatures aren't really my expertise

question: We'll give you three thousand dollars on delivery. Ace immediately becomes the narrator of a nature show.
answer: The dolphin is a social creature. Capable of complex communication. Traveling in large groups or schools

question: Good question, Aguado first I'd establish a motive. In this case the killer saw the size of the bug's dick, and became insanely jealous. The other cops all react with a big "ooooooo". Aguado has no comeback. Ace comes face to face with him. Then I'd lose thirty pounds porking his wife. Aguado suddenly loses it and swings at Ace. With a lightening move, Ace sidesteps the punch and forces Aguado's face down next to the dead bug. Now kiss and make up. Ace walks off. LLLOOOSER! Ace walks to the desk of EMILIO ECHAVEZ, a young energetic member of the homicide division. Ace has a silly impish look on his face. I miss you.
answer: It's not a good time, Ace. If Einhorn sees me talking to you I'm gonna be history.

question: Okay. Just tell me what you got on Snowflake. That's all I need.
answer: I can't say anything. My hands are tied.

question: Sounds like my kind of a party. A cop comes to Emilio's desk.
answer: Ace, please?!

question: Just tell me who's working the case?
answer: Aguado.

question: Aguado?! He's pimple juice! He's the poster child for lead paint chip eaters!

Ace nonchalantly sits back in a chair, pops a sunflower seed into his mouth and cracks it loudly. Okay, okay. We checked all the local animal rights groups, taxidermists, and we're running a check through DMV on all recent van rentals. So far, nada.

question: Any unusual bets being made?
answer: Ace, it's the Super Bowl, of course there's bets being made.

question: What'd you find out about the tank?
answer: Nothing weird. Just the tire tracks and the exit route. The guard didn't see anything.

question: That's it?
answer: That's it. I swear. Now please go away!

question: You know something? YOU'RE NICE! Ace gets up and exits the room. Then just as Emilio sighs with relief, Ace pops back in. What about crazy Philly fans? The elevator bell rings. Out steps police LT. LOIS EINHORN, mid 30s, with a slender build, a great pair of legs and a bad tude. Holy Testicle Tuesday!

question: I came to confess. I was the second gunman on the grassy knoll.

question: Whewww now I feel better! Ace turns to go. Of course, that might not do any good. You see, nobody's missing a porpoise. It's a dolphin that's been taken. The common Harbor Porpoise has an abrupt snout, pointed teeth, and a triangular thorasic fin, while the Bottlenose Dolphin, or Tursiops Truncatus, has an elongated beak, round, cone-shaped teeth, and a distinctive serrated dorsal appendage. But I'm sure you already knew that. That's what turns me on about you. Hey maybe I'll give you a call sometime, lieutenant. Your number still 911? Alrighty then! Ace exits. CUT TO: Excuse me?! Is Greg here?! The burnout's head thrashes on. No acknowledgement of Ace. Thank you! Ace heads for the basement stairs. Tom Vu! I pay for sex! You can too! CLICK! question: Super, and thank you for asking. Hope you're having a nice day.

question: I certainly do.
answer: That's a Norwegian whaling fleet. I'm sending them new directional coordinates They'll find Jimmy Hoffa before they find any Humpbacks.

question: Gravy. Woodstock moves to a different screen.

question: I'm very attracted to you right now. Woodstock chuckles.

question: Aren't I? Can you still tap into all the aquatic supply store in the area?

question: I want to trace the sale of any equipment for transporting or housing a dolphin within the past few months

question: Okay then, try to remember the sixties.

question: bastard.

question: RRREHEHEALLY!
answer: That, my friend, is the face of the enemy. He pages through his file on screen. Always tryin' to get his hands on endangered species Newspaper articles fill the screen. One shows a picture of Camp and some Dolphin players.

answer: Camp donated the land the new stadium's built on. Oh, look at this, he's throwin' another, "I'm the richest man in the universe" party.

question: Hmmm I wonder if I can find myself a date.
answer: I'm really going out on a limb here, Ventura. Camp's social events are strictly A-list.

question: 'Well, Chuck the date started off good, but just before we got to the party, she seemed to tense up.' Melissa rolls her eyes, then taps a huge door knocker.
answer: I swear, if you do anything to embarrass me in front of Camp

question: Be sure that you do. If I had been drinking out of that toilet, I might have been killed! Ace shakes Camp's hand and notices his ring. He holds on to get a better look. It's a very distinct, commemorative ring. Camp wants his hand back but Ace won't let go. Melissa finally drags Ace away.
answer: We'd better go. Camp looks on and shakes his head. Y'know, I don't even want to know why your pants are missing! I don't care what happened! You could have cost me my job.

question: I was wrong about Camp. He's breaking the law but he's not our guy.

question: This is the key. Right here!

question: So small! So unnoticeable! Yet an invaluable piece of our twisted little jigsaw puzzle! Melissa stares at Ace like he's gone crazy. There is a flash of headlights and a car horn. question: I found it in the filter. And it's not a pebble. It is a rare, triangular cut, orange amber. Ace hands Melissa the stone and quickly goes to one of her bookcases.

question: Tonight I saw the exact same stone in Camp's ring. Ace finds a book on the Dolphin team and flips through it.

question: N. Camp's clean. His ring wasn't missing a stone. But whoever was in that tank had a ring just like his.
answer: Wait a second. What ring? Ace hands her the book. It's open to a photo of

question: The 1982 Dolphin AFC Championship ring. Melissa holds the stone up to the picture. It's a perfect match. I find the ring with the missing stone, I find Snowflake.
answer: How are you gonna do that?

question: Simple.
answer: Ace, that stone could have come from anywhere. An earring, a necklace

question: It came from an '82 AFC Championship ring.
answer: Lt. Einhorn thinks it was an animal rights group. Have you heard of FAN?

question: Free Animals Now? Started in 1982 by Chelsea Gamble, daughter of the famous industrialist, Fischer Gamble? Over half a million members from Florida to Finland? No. Who are they?
answer: Did you know that last year they sent threatening letters to 127 college teams, demanding the release of their mascots? At last count

question: What do you feed your dog? We see Melissa's dog lying near Ace's feet.
answer: Ah dog food, why?

question: He's miserable.
answer: What are you talking about?

question: He's just very unhappy, I feel sorry for him. Bad diet, isolated environment. It's amazing he's still alive.
answer: You're just mad because your stupid pebble theory didn't work out and you don't know how to express your anger.

question: Yeah? And you're ugly.
answer: I'm not even gonna' talk to you, please leave.

question: What, so you can beat him? Fatty!
answer: You are unbelievable. The phone rings inside the house. Melissa goes to answer it. Hiring you was a huge mistake! The door slams and Ace is alone with the dog. After a moment he reaches down to pet it and we all see that it is one of the happiest dogs in the world.

question: E, forget it. She's right. Besides, I wouldn't want someone tracing my steps and pointing out all the mistakes I made. Ace crosses to
answer: Oh, so, you don't think this in an obvious suicide, Mr. Pet Detective?

question: Well, I wouldn't say that. Lord knows, there is plenty of evidence here to support your theory, except of course that spot of blood on the balcony. On the railing, sure enough, there is a tiny spot of blood. Einhorn glares at a couple of nearby cops. They look down. May I tell you what I think happened? Alrighty then! Ace moves as he talks. Roger Podacter went out after work. He had a few drinks, and he came home. But he wasn't alone. Someone was with him in this apartment. There was a struggle, and then Roger Podacter was thrown over that balcony. Roger Podacter didn't commit suicide. He was murdered. A beat as everyone considers this.
answer: Well, that's a very entertaining story, but real detectives have to worry about that little thing lawyers call evidence. Ace picks up a lottery ticket on Podacter's desk and becomes a condescending kid show host.

question: Let's take a trip to clue corner, shall we? Can anyone tell me why a man buys a lottery ticket on the day he is going to commit suicide? Or why the family pet, suffering from acute canine trauma, clawed at the bedroom door until his paws bled? How about the blood on the railing? I'll bet if we put our thinking caps on we'll see that it was the result of the struggle that took place inside this apartment while Mr. Podacter was still alive!
answer: Not a bad try for a pet detective, but not near conclusive enough for us real investigators. First, people buy lottery tickets everyday. It's a habit. It doesn't prove a thing. Second, the dog wasn't suffering from canine trauma, he was suffering from bladder trauma. Sergeant Neilson found a piss stain as big as Lake Huron near the bed. And third, the blood on the railing. Simple. He doesn't jump far enough and whacks his head. A fact confirmed by the paramedics who found cuts on his scalp, with traces of a white chalky substance. i.e. plaster from the balcony. Einhorn shows Ace the paramedics report. Everyone is impressed with Einhorn. So much for your murder, Ventura.

question: Only this AAAAAAAWWWWWWWWWWW Ace sustains an incredible Pavorati note, while he repeatedly opens and closes the glass door between them. When the door is closed nothing can be heard. This is double paned, sound- proofed glass. There's no way this neighbor could have heard Podacter scream on the way down with this door shut. The scream he heard came from inside this apartment, before Podacter was thrown over the railing! And the muderer closed the door before he left! Yes! Yesss! I have exorcised the demons! This house is clear.
answer: What are you thinking?

question: I'm thinking this whole thing is connected somehow. I'm thinking I want to find that other ring!
answer: You checked all the rings.

question: I know, Pessimistress. Could anyone else have gotten a ring that year?
answer: No. Camp was the only honoree. Just players and coaches. Everyone in the photo.

question: Receipts! There must be receipts! You have a key to the office.
answer: Ace this has been a really tough day. Can't we do this in the morning? Ace looks at his watch.

question: Absolutely. EXT. DOLPHIN HEADQUARTERS - 1:00 AM Ace's car screeches to a stop, in front of the building. Ace jumps out, followed by Melissa.
answer: These files go back to seventy- eight. That was pretty impressive, what you did back at the apartment.

question: You don't have to tell me. I was there.
answer: Maybe you should have joined the police force become a real detective.

question: I don't do humans. Melissa gets a bit closer.
answer: You really love animals, don't you? Ace stops searching and looks into her eyes.

question: I feel a kinship with them. I understand them. Wanna hear something kinda spooky?
answer: Sure. She gets closer still.

question: One time, when I was about twelve, I had this dream that I was being followed by a dog with rabies. He had these really bloodshot eyes and foam coming out of his mouth and just before I got to my front door he jumped on me and sunk his teeth in. Then I woke up, and felt the back of my neck check this out. Ace motions for Melissa to feel the back of his neck, but when she does, he snaps at her hand, barking like a vicious dog. ARARAR!!! Melissa jumps out of her skin.
answer: Ohhh!! You bastard!

question: I'm sorry. I couldn't stop myself. Are these all the receipts?
answer: I don't know.

question: There's only a dozen of them here. Ace turns from the file cabinet with a hopeless look on his face. Melissa begins to clean up his mess.
answer: Gee maybe they were misplaced because somebody didn't put the files back when he was

question: Who the hell is that?
answer: What Ace crosses to a big picture of the '82 team that hangs on the aadjacent wall and points out a player.

question: That! Who the hell is that?! He quickly pulls out his crossed out pictures of the team and begins to compare the two.
answer: Oh, that's Ray Finkle the kicker. Don't you know who Ray Finkle is?

question: No! How come he's not in this picture?! Melissa checks Ace's photo.
answer: This was the picture you were using? This was taken earlier in the year. Finkle wasn't added to the roster till mid-season. She starts to realize what Ace has already figured out. He's the guy that missed the final field goal in the Super Bowl that year. Cost the Dolphins the game.

question: But he got a ring?
answer: Definitely. INT. STADIUM/PUBLIC RELATIONS OFFICE - LATER Ace and Melissa look through Finkle's file on a microfiche screen. Newspaper articles, headshots flash before them 'Replacement Kicker Having Great Year' 'Ready For Super Bowl, Confident Kicker Boasts'.

question: 'Field Goal Sails Wide, Dolphins Lose Super Bowl'.
answer: The kick heard round the world. That was Finkle. The Dolphins lost by one point. Another headline hits the screen Poor guy.

question: Poor guy with a motive, baby. Where is he now?
answer: Last I heard, he went back to his home town, Collier County. He used to work in a bar up there. Can you drop me off before you go?

question: No way. It may not be safe at your apartment, and you shouldn't be left alone.
answer: What do you suggest? CUT TO: OH man oh man! Oh wow!

question: No, sir. I'm just a very big Finkle fan. This is my Graceland, sir. Mrs. Finkle, a sweet, adorable elderly woman comes over.
answer: Will you put that gun down. The boy's a fan of our son. So nice to meet you. I'm Ray's mother, and this is Ray's father.

question: It's a real honor.
answer: My Ray is so appreciative of his fans. He'll be so pleased you stopped by.

question: Are you expecting Ray anytime soon?
answer: Oh, yes. I expect him home any minute. Ace is surprised. Would you like some cookies? I just baked them. Mrs. Finkle hurries off to the kitchen. Ace smiles at Mr. Finkle. The guy's a corpse.

question: When Ray gets back and starts kicking again, he'll never even know he was gone. I kept his room just the way he left it. She opens the door to Ray's room. Ace steps in.
answer: Oooh boy.

question: What a sports nut, huh? In the center of the room is a movie projector.
answer: May I?

question: Oh yes. By all means. Mrs. Finkle shuts the lights off. Ace turns on the projector. The film flickers over the "Marino must die!!!" graffiti. It's the final play of the Super Bowl. Marino takes the snap, Finkle kicks and the ball sails wide. The film repeats itself ad infinitum.
answer: Melissa, it's Ace.

question: Melissa, it's Ace.
answer: Ace? Where are you? INTERCUT ACE/MELISSA

question: I'm in Psychoville and Finkle's the Mayor. Where's Dan Marino?
answer: Marino? Why?

question: Because he's about to join Snowflake. I gotta know where he is.
answer: Okay, hold on Melissa checks Marino's itinerary. Ace waits, impatiently.

question: Come on. Come on In the background, we see two paramedics exit the gas station office rolling a dead body on a gurney. The area of the sheet that covers the face is a giant red spot. We widen to see them load good old Mr. Bilbo into an ambulance and drive away, ringing the station bell one more time. Ace doesn't notice.
answer: Ah, he had practice. Then he has a commercial shoot out at the Prescott Sound Stage.

question: Where is that?
answer: It's on Route One by the Six Cut Off. Thirty minutes outside of town.

question: Okay, that's about fifteen miles from me. Call the police. Get extra security over there now.
answer: Ace, tell me what's going on. Ace? The payphone dangles off the hook. Ace is

question: So I protect the hands that protect me. With Isotoners. Marino gets carted off by FIVE HUGE LINEMEN.
answer: Good. Remember, exit camera right. That's to your left. Alright, let's get ready to shoot this.

question: See, in 82 we just choked. We had a chance to win it and we didn't
answer: Dan, are you ready?

question: Ah, sure. I'll tell you later.
answer: And action!

question: Hi, I'm Dan Marino. If anyone knows the value of protection, it's me We see an old clip of Marino getting sacked. So I protect the hands that protect me. With Isotoners. The five linemen grab Marino and run off camera.
answer: And cut! That was good. Again from one. But two of the linemen keep running with Marino I said cut!! And they keep running. What the hell are they doing? Right out the studio door. Then the cops arrive and race after them. Two linemen stumble out of the dressing room holding their heads.

question: I'm sorry. I can't comment any further. Now if you'll excuse me. Einhorn pushes her way through the crowd of reporters. Emilio, get me the autopsy on Podacter! Aguado, send out a memo. No one talks to the press And somebody get me a cup of coffee!
answer: Tonight on "MIAMI VICE", Crockett geets the boss coffee! Ace is in her office, popping sunflower seeds, kicking back. Einhorn walks to her private bathroom.

question: Ventura, when I get out of this bathroom, you better be gone.

question: Oh yeah?
answer: yeah, ever hear of a former Dolphin kicker named Ray Finkle? The water shuts off. Einhorn appears around the corner.

question: Alright, Ventura. Make it quick.

Blames the whole thing on Marino. We're talking paranoid, delusional psychosis. I saw the guy's room Cozy, if you're Hannibal Lector.

question: So how does Roger Podacter fit in?
answer: My guess is Finkle was snooping around. Podacter recognized him. End of story. As for Snowflake they gave him Finkle's number, and taught him how to kick a field goal. Finkle took it personally. Einhorn listens with great interest.

question: So where is Finkle, now?
answer: He broke out of a metal hospital. Did a Claude Raines. He's been planning his revenge for years. Waiting for the perfect time to get back at the Dolphins. The time when it would hurt them the most. Super Bowl time! Man, I'm tired of being right! Einhorn walks in front and sits on the edge of the desk. She's totally softened her demeanor.

question: Congratulations. You've done some fine detective work, Ace.
answer: Ahh, could you talk in my good ear. I thought I heard you call me Ace. Einhorn gets real close.

question: Maybe I was wrong about you. Maybe you are more than just a pet dick. SHE SUDDENLY PLANTS A MAJOR, TONSIL CLEANING, OPEN MOUTHED KISS ON ACE. Objects are knocked off the desk as they lean back.
answer: Your gun's digging into my hip. More kissing, the Ace stops.

question: What's wrong, Ace? Want me to read you your rights?
answer: Maybe later.

question: What is it? That bony little bitch, Melissa Robinson?
answer: No. You just don't do anything for me. He quickly adjusts his crotch, to conceal the erection. Einhorn withdraws with a coy smile.

question: I'll be here if you ever want a real woman. There's a sharp KNOCK at the door. What is it? Aguado opens the door.
answer: Everything okay in here? Heard some commotion.

question: Fine, Sergeant.
answer: You want me to throw him out?

question: Why don't you throw yourself out.
answer: Yes, ma'am. A crestfallen Aguado exits. Ace heads for the door.

question: When I find Snowflake, I'll deliver Marino. He exits. Nice to see you again! The Burnout just keeps thrashing. Ace spots Woodstock watching the band and joins him.
answer: St. Francis, how's it goin'?

question: That's none of your damn business.
answer: Isn't it?

question: Is it?
answer: Anything new on that dolphin?

question: Got his picture on some tuna cans, but nothing so far. A singer ROARS on stage. He sounds like a garbage disposal full of cutlery.
answer: So, what can I do for you today?

question: I need info on a football flunky named Ray Finkle.
answer: Sorry, Ace, I can't help you right now. I gotta watch this band! They are the shit!

question: Are they?
answer: Aren't they?

question: Alright then. Don't worry about it. I mean dolphins aren't exactly an endangered species. It's not like the whole food chain's gonna be affected if one highly intelligent mammal dies a slow and painful death! Hell, if the band is loud enough, you won't even hear its pitiful whimpering!! Ace does his best suffering dolphin impression. Woodstock is no longer enjoying the band. CUT TO:
answer: This guy's last reported income was September, 1982.

question: Well then. We know he's incredibly thrifty.
answer: Is he?

question: Isn't he? Woodstock types in more information. Finkle's TRW flashes on the screen.
answer: Well, I think we can be pretty sure he's involved in the kidnapping of the dolphin.

question: Really? What makes you say that?
answer: There's two-thousand dollars worth of smelts on his VISA card. After a beat Ace realizes it was a bad joke.

question: Please yank me no further. I beg of you.
answer: Alright already. The last time this guy used his credit card was June, '84. He rented a car from Avis. And eww he was a bad boy. They found it abandoned two months later in South Miami.

question: Anything else?
answer: Nope.

question: Well you did all you could. Thanks for nothin.
answer: Hey man, according to this, your friend Ray Finkle doesn't exist.

question: Hmm, I know what that's like.
answer: Do you?

question: Don't I? Did you get all the spiders outta there? Ace heads out, then freezes. The two thugs that took Marino are standing at the exit. Then they see Ace and start towards him, reaching inside their coats. Suddenly the music starts. The burnout's head wails again. His manic gyrations interfere with the thugs long enough for Ace to bolt. One of the thugs pushes the burnout violently against the wall as they pursue Ace. ONE, TWO, THREE, FOUR, SPANK ME MOMMY!!! The audience looks at Ace for a second. Then the band members exchange a look and go for it!! It's a nightmarish little ditty. Ace sings like one of Satan's minions. URGHHUURRAAAW! ARGHUURRRREEEW! The crowd seems to understand. They throw the thugs high in the air again and mosh them away from the stage. The Thugs are shooting stray bullets the whole time. Ace incites the crowd, even more now, with a punching gesture. The crowd follows their new leader, punching with one hand, moshing with the other. The thugs get the living crap "moshed" out of them. When the song ends, Ace raises fists in the air. The cheering crowd violently drops the thugs. They're out cold.
answer: Who is it?

question: Ira.
answer: Ira who?

question: I refuse to do a 'knock knock joke'. Come on, open up! Melissa opens the door.
answer: Ace, what are you doing? It's the middle of the night!

question: You have to commit me. Finkle escaped from Shady Acres in Tampa. They still have some of his stuff.
answer: So you think they're going to let us just waltz in and look around?

question: You're brother won't be the first professional football player we've treated.
answer: Is that right?

question: Yes. We're very sensitive to the emotional stress athletes have to endure. Ace runs across the b.g. screaming "I'm open! I'm open!" We'll have to do some preliminary evaluations, but I think your brother will fit in nicely here.
answer: That's a relief, Doctor. Ace takes a "snap" from a three-foot hedge and dives over it into the end zone. Melissa and the doctor stop to watch him.

question: He seems to have some difficulty letting go of the game. Has he had a long history of mental illness?
answer: As long as I've known him. Ace does a wild touchdown dance with some of the other patients participating.

question: A massive search ended today when rescue workers were unable to find the body of Lois Einhorn a camper reported lost since Friday Lois Einhorn holy shit balls. Ace sits bewildered.
answer: Echavez.

question: This is Chicken Little. The sky is falling.
answer: What? I don't get it. What's it mean? INTERCUT ACE/EMILIO

question: It means she's involved in this. The article's dated the day before Finkle disappeared.
answer: Before who disappeared?

question: Finkle. Ray Finkle the guy who took the dolphin? The guy you're supposed to be looking for?! Einhorn didn't tell you, did she?
answer: Hey, Ace. I see where you're goin' with this and you're goin' alone. A Crazy Guy stands next to Ace now and begins mimicking everything he says.

question: Come on, E. I tell her about Finkle, she doesn't tell a soul. I have an article here that connects her with Finkle. You gotta' check her out. Do you mind? The Crazy Guy stops and moves to one of the phones.
answer: Ace, I like my job. I get health insurance and benefits.

question: Brian Piccalo is dead. Ace breaks down. Melissa hangs up the phone and leads him away. We hear a thrash version of the theme to "Brian's Song" as they exit the hospital. Good job today. You're quite a dirty rotten filthy liar.
answer: Thanks. Are you sure you don't want to stay here with me?

question: Naw, I got some thinking to do. Besides, you'd be safer with Salman Rushdie
answer: Okay. She gets out of the car, then turns and leans in the window. Listen I know there isn't much time left. The game is tomorrow. But I know you've done your best. It's just an impossible situation. I don't expect..

question: Ace Ventura. Pet detective. I've been sent in with a special play. Quarterback sneak.
answer: Penalty. Too many men on the field. Ace turns. Einhorn's holding a gun on them from the other side of Snowflake's tank. I warned you, Ventura.

question: What happened to "Ace"?
answer: Good question. She pulls out a cellular phone and dials.

question: Be careful with that phone, lieutenant. I wouldn't want you to get a tumor.
answer: Sergeant Aguado, it's Lt. Einhorn. Get some men over to the old ironworks factory on Victoria Road. I've got the kidnapper trapped in the warehouse. It's Ace Ventura. He's killed Marino and Snowflake. Einhorn smiles as she puts the phone away. Vinnie! Roc! Get in here! Ace gets a very guilty look.
